title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.001
frontText: Aurora storage engine automatically distributes _____ copies of protection groups across _____ availability zones.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.002
frontText: Amazon Aurora allows you to launch __________ for scaling out read operations and accessing the same shared storage engine.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.003
frontText: In the event of a writer node failure, the Amazon Aurora cluster chooses an available Aurora replica to be promoted to a writer. The first criteria evaluated for promoting an Aurora replica is __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.004
frontText: The least downtime method for migrating an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL to an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL is to _______________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.005
frontText: Creating a ______________ on Amazon Aurora is faster and more space‐saving than restoring from a snapshot.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.006
frontText: __________ is the Aurora feature that allows you to rewind your Amazon Aurora MySQL cluster to the time you specify without restoring the entire database.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.007
frontText: The maximum backtrack window is ________ hours.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.008
frontText: Using ______________________ enables you to test the Amazon Aurora MySQL cluster fault tolerance.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.009
frontText: For applications that require globally distributed execution, using __________ will span multiple AWS regions.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.010
frontText: __________ is an on‐demand configuration for Amazon Aurora that automatically scales the compute layer and adjusts capacity based on application demand.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.011
frontText: An Amazon Aurora cluster dynamically adjusts the number of Aurora replicas provisioned by configuring __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.012
frontText: Amazon Aurora Auto Scaling allows you to choose the target metric __________ or __________.
backText: Average CPU utilization of Aurora replicas; Average connections of Aurora replicas

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.013
frontText: Aurora Serverless automatically scales up and down based on resource utilization. You must specify the minimum and maximum ________________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.014
frontText: The __________ in Amazon Aurora allows you to collect and stream database activities and push them to a Kinesis Stream.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.015
frontText: For encryption at rest, Amazon RDS uses the __________ encryption algorithm.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.016
frontText: Amazon DocumentDB can have __________ read replicas and scale the storage up to __________ TB per cluster.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.017
frontText: Using Amazon DocumentDB global clusters, you can recover from region‐wide outages and enable low‐latency global reads in up to __________ AWS regions.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.018
frontText: It’s considered a best practice to have the value of the BufferCacheHitRatio metric as __________ as possible, as reading data from working set memory is faster and more cost‐effective than reading from the storage volume.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.019
frontText: You can use __________ to automatically rotate the secrets for Amazon DocumentDB.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.020
frontText: In Amazon DocumentDB, you can use the __________ command to learn and analyze a query plan for a particular query. It’s useful to have this information to modify a query to improve its performance.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.021
frontText: The __________ migration approach to Amazon DocumentDB uses the mongodump and mongorestore tools. To replicate the ongoing changes, use __________ in __________ mode.
backText: Hybrid, AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS), CDC (change data capture)

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.022
frontText: Which option in the Amazon DocumentDB cluster parameter group enables the query profiling?

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.023
frontText: Amazon DocumentDB is publicly accessible, and you can use the cluster endpoint to access it from anywhere. True or false?
backText: False. Amazon DocumentDB cluster is deployed in a private subnet and needs a jump server, VPN connection, or AWS Cloud9 to be accessible.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.024
frontText: You cannot disable an Amazon DocumentDB backup retention period. By default the backups are retained for __________ day(s) and can go up to __________ days.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.025
frontText: To enable auditing in Amazon DocumentDB cluster, you need to set your cluster to publish the logs in __________. In the cluster parameter group, you need to enable the __________ parameter.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.026
frontText: With Amazon QLDB you can prevent doing a full table scan when retrieving a document by creating an __________ and adding a where condition on the __________ field.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.027
frontText:
You can query the Amazon QLDB document revision history by running the following query:
SELECT * FROM __________ ( table_name | table_id, start-time, end-time) AS h
WHERE h.metadata.id = 'id'

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.028
frontText: Amazon QLDB control concurrency conflicts by using __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.029
frontText: A __________ is a cryptographic representation of your ledger’s entire journal at a point in time.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.030
frontText: AWS CloudFormation templates support __________ and __________ formats.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.031
frontText: __________ is a feature from AWS CloudFormation to deploy stacks across AWS regions and accounts.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.032
frontText: By changing the engine in an existing Amazon RDS through AWS CloudFormation, a new Amazon RDS instance will be deployed. True or false?

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.033
frontText: AWS CloudFormation supports as dynamic reference patterns: for plaintext stored in __________ using __________, and encrypted using __________ using __________.
backText: SSM Parameter Store, ssm, SecureString, ssm‐secure

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.034
frontText: It’s considered a best practice to use AWS Secrets Manager to store, encrypt, and rotate credentials and secrets. AWS CloudFormation supports as dynamic parameter using resolve: __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.035
frontText: By deleting a CloudFormation stack, you delete all resources deployed from it, unless you use the DeletionPolicy with the __________ option in the template.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.036
frontText: Nested stacks are considered best practice. True or false?

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.037
frontText: A CloudFormation template can be uploaded at launch creation or using Amazon S3. True or false?

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.038
frontText: In a CloudFormation template, __________ is the only mandatory section.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.039
frontText: Fn::FindInMap, Fn::GetAtt, and Ref are examples of __________ in an AWS CloudFormation template.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.040
frontText: The purpose‐built database optimized for storing and querying relationships between data items is the __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.041
frontText: __________ is well suited to creating personalized advertising, offers, and services tailored to similar preferences.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.042
frontText: Amazon Neptune supports the graph models __________ and __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.043
frontText: Amazon Neptune supports the following query languages: __________, __________ and __________.
backText: Apache TinkerPop Gremlin, SPARQL, and openCypher

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.044
frontText: An Amazon Neptune DB cluster allows you to add up to __________ read replicas to run read‐only queries.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.045
frontText: Amazon Neptune connects specific data points called __________ and creates relationships called __________ in the form of graphs that can be pulled by users with queries.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.046
frontText: Amazon Neptune data is stored on a clustered volume that consists of a collection of logical blocks known as segments. The data in each segment is replicated across __________ availability zones and __________ copies of each segment in each availability zone. In total there are __________ copies of the data.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.047
frontText: Having one or more __________ increases the Amazon Neptune cluster availability.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.048
frontText: To load a large amount of data into Redshift optimizing parallelism and block utilization, you should __________ the data into files with a uniform size from 1 __________ to 1 GB and have the number of files a __________ of the slices number of your cluster.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.049
frontText: One way to distribute a large table data in your Redshift cluster is to choose a column with high cardinality values, setting the distribution style to _______ and setting this column as the ________ key.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.050
frontText: You use a __________ to allow access to your Redshift cluster from a specific IP address or an application security group.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.051
frontText: An Amazon Redshift __________ is used to store the data to disk in an ordered manner to minimize the number of blocks read when performing query filtering using the columns used on it.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.052
frontText: Amazon Redshift is a good fit for the star schema table design, where you have a fact table used in SQL joins with several __________ tables.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.053
frontText: To increase CPU capacity to the Amazon Redshift cluster, you can add new __________ of the same type.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.054
frontText: Encode auto is set to allow Redshift to manage __________ for all the columns in a table by default.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.055
frontText: You should avoid statements with select * on Redshift, as it stores data in a __________ storage, and this SQL query requires reads on all column blocks.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.056
frontText: __________ and Memcached are engine options to cache data with Amazon ElastiCache.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.057
frontText: Amazon ElastiCache for __________ is single threaded so it doesn’t take much advantage of many CPU cores on the same node, while Amazon ElastiCache for __________ is multithreaded and can use multiple cores on a single node.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.058
frontText: With Redis cluster mode __________, you can scale with one primary and up to 5 replicas per shard, with a total of 90 nodes per cluster. You can increase it to 500 nodes per cluster on Redis version 5.0.6 or above.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.059
frontText: Amazon ElastiCache for __________ provides data __________ and compliance certification for PCI DSS.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.060
frontText: Amazon ElastiCache for Memcached doesn’t provide __________ availability with replication.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.061
frontText: To provide resilience and recoverability, you can use a __________ strategy for Amazon ElastiCache for Redis.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.062
frontText: Amazon ElastiCache for __________ provides support for complex data type, whereas ElastiCache for __________ does not.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.063
frontText: The use of multiple shards is available in Amazon ElastiCache for Memcached and ElastiCache for Redis with cluster mode __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.064
frontText: AWS DMS uses an infrastructure component called a __________ instance that controls one or more replication tasks.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.065
frontText: You can use __________ as target endpoints for AWS DMS to save data as files and use it in a data lake concept.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.066
frontText: The __________ can be used to convert schemas from the source to the target database when migrating from one database engine to another in AWS.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.067
frontText: If you don’t use the AWS Schema Conversion Tool when migrating from Oracle to Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL, AWS DMS creates only the tables and __________ by default.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.068
frontText: When using AWS DMS, you can group tables related to each other in the same __________ in order to restart all of them in case of failure and have other groups of tables in other __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.069
frontText: You can’t use AWS DMS along with the AWS Schema Conversion Tool replication agents to migrate large databases using AWS Snowball devices. True or false?
backText: False. You can use AWS SCT replication agents to migrate very large databases and synchronize them with AWS Snowball device migration and AWS DMS tasks.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.070
frontText: Amazon DocumentDB can be used as a __________ endpoint as well as a __________ endpoint with AWS DMS.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.071
frontText: An AWS DMS replication instance is created in a VPC, and traffic from its __________ or __________ address needs to be allowed in the target Amazon RDS instances.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.072
frontText: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed __________ database designed for supporting user‐related metadata, mobile app or games, shopping carts and product catalogs, sessions leaderboards, etc.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.073
frontText: The __________ read mode maximizes the read throughput but might not always reflect a recently completed write. Consistency across all copies of data is usually reached within a second.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.074
frontText: Amazon DynamoDB supports only a single partition key with an optional sort key per table or index. The combination of both keys is called a __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.075
frontText: DynamoDB supports two kinds of indexes: __________ and __________ __________.
backText: Local Secondary Indexes (LSIs), Global Secondary Indexes (GSIs)

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.076
frontText: A DynamoDB Local Secondary Index can be created at __________, and each table supports up to __________ indexes.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.077
frontText: A DynamoDB Global Secondary Index can be created, modified, and deleted at __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.078
frontText:
A scan operation features the following characteristics:
By default, a scan operation returns all attributes, but you can use _________ to return only the ones you actually need.
Scans are sequential, and you can speed up a scan through parallel scans using __________ and __________.
Scans can be slow, especially with very large tables, and can easily consume your provisioned __________.
backText: ProjectExpression, Segments, Total Segments, read throughput

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.079
frontText: DynamoDB query operations allow you to select multiple items that have the same __________ but different __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.080
frontText: DynamoDB has two capacity modes: __________ and __________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.081
frontText: DynamoDB on‐demand capacity is suited for __________ or __________ workloads. It is the pay‐as‐you‐go model for DynamoDB that will elastically grow up to the required level of throughput.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.082
frontText: With __________, you specify the number of reads and writes per second that you require for your application. You can use __________ to adjust your table’s provisioned capacity automatically in response to traffic changes.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.083
frontText: An RCU represents one strongly consistent per second for an item up to __________ in size.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.084
frontText: An RCU represents two eventually consistent reads per second for an item up to __________ in size.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.085
frontText: A WCU represents one write per second for an item up to __________ in size.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.086
frontText: DAX is a fully managed in‐memory __________ cache type for DynamoDB that runs within a cluster allowing __________ response times.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.087
frontText: A DynamoDB DAX cluster is ideal for applications that require __________ reads against a __________ set of data and also for applications that are read‐__________, but are also cost‐__________.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.088
frontText: DynamoDB __________ provide developers with atomicity, consistency, isolation, and durability (ACID) features across one or more tables. DynamoDB performs two underlying reads or writes of every item in the block, one to prepare and the other to commit the operation.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.089
frontText: DynamoDB supports event‐oriented architectures through __________ or __________. It does item‐level change data capture (CDC) in near real time.
backText: DynamoDB Streams, Kinesis Data Streams for DynamoDB

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.090
frontText: Kinesis Data Streams for DynamoDB allows data retention up to __________. It supports up to __________ concurrent consumers.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.091
frontText: DynamoDB Streams allows data retention up to __________. It supports up to ___ concurrent consumers per shard.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.092
frontText: DynamoDB global tables ensure that updates performed in any region are propagated to other regions. The data in all regions is __________ consistent, providing __________ latency responses for your globally distributed application at any scale.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.093
frontText: DynamoDB supports the data life cycle through the __________ attribute. The TTL is an item‐level attribute represented as an epoch timestamp mark that indicates that the item can be deleted by an automatic background process, without consuming __________ or causing extra costs.
backText: Time to live (TTL), provisioned capacity units

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.094
frontText: A __________ is the ordered list of node hashes that QLDB returns for a given digest and document revision.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.095
frontText: DynamoDB is perfect for large‐scale applications that require __________ latency and __________ concurrency for millions of transactions per second.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.096
frontText: The __________ read mode returns a result that reflects all writes that received a successful response prior to the read. The trade‐off is that it will consume twice the read capacity units.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.097
frontText: DynamoDB Local Secondary Index supports __________ consistency models.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.098
frontText: DynamoDB Local Secondary Index supports only composite keys and shares the __________ and __________ with the base table.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.099
frontText: DynamoDB Global Secondary Index supports __________ consistency models.

title: fc778950.AWSCDSG.100
frontText: DynamoDB Global Secondary Index supports simple and composite keys, has its own __________, and can have different attributes as __________.
